title: PR: Add cli arguments to run the electron build as a webserver backend (headless) Replacement for #81474
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
This issue is a part of: #81474 
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
it offers a secund way to serve vscode-online via the electron build it self without additional nodejs server and additional vscode-web code build.


## Goals
- could reduce the overall maintance overhead if we go with a single code base for both cases.
- don't clashes with currrent vscode-web team
- is maybe faster implamented and will reduce in faster release cycles.

## Create a secund Branch based on electron.
The idea is to combine both to contribute a code-cli --server flag to run headless and get used via the browser.

- We know from the microsoft ai research team that we can run electron headless
```
/*
Now to force Electron in software mode in the cloud, Chrome blacklisted GPUs from running. You
 cannot run it on Azure, AWS, Google Cloud. so you need to disable that by doing the following:
*/
const { app } = require(‚Äòelectron‚Äô)
app.commandLine.appendSwitch(‚Äò ‚Äî ignore-gpu-blacklist‚Äô)
//To not render the Electron window, you just hide it when constructing it:
new BrowserWindow({ width: 1280, height: 800, show: false })
```
- We know from the electron team that we can start external reachable server services via child process spawn
```js
const { fork } = require('child_process')
const ps = fork(`${__dirname}/server.js`)
// The __dirname variable is required if you want to deploy on a binary build otherwise the script won‚Äôt be reached properly.
```

title: Switch to polling for watching changes on config files
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81579 got answered by @sandy081 

```
This is to watch changes for user configuration data in VS Code.

Settings
Keybindings
Snippets
It's also to watch log files when output panel is opened.

We do not watch the whole user home directory, but code/User folder under user home directory. code/User folder is the one created by VS Code for storing above user data.
```

I Propose here to add a extra RTC Channel for Settings File Updates to call a reread of a settings file
so on save of a settings file we simply emit a event to that channel and vscode will reread its configuration this saves a ton of filewatchers.

we should also add a reload vscode button.

title: Clean our monospace font stack
body:
Currently it sit at:

```css
.mac { --monaco-monospace-font: "SF Mono", Monaco, Menlo, Inconsolata, "Courier New", monospace; }
.windows { --monaco-monospace-font: Consolas, Inconsolata, "Courier New", monospace; }
.linux { --monaco-monospace-font: "Droid Sans Mono", Inconsolata, "Courier New", monospace, "Droid Sans Fallback"; }
```

@bpasero Do you know where these choices come from? `Inconsolata` is rather narrow and not good for UI display. `Droid Sans Mono` isn't available on Fedora, for example, and it causes UI to fallback to use a serif font `Liberation Serif`.

IMO it should be:

```css
.mac { --monaco-monospace-font: "SF Mono", Monaco, Menlo, Courier, monospace; }
.windows { --monaco-monospace-font: Consolas, "Courier New", monospace; }
.linux { --monaco-monospace-font: "Ubuntu Mono", "Liberation Mono", "DejaVu Sans Mono", monospace; }
```

Justifications:

- `font-family: monospace` fallback chosen by Chrome:
  - Win: `Courier New`
  - macOS: `Courier`
  - Ubuntu / Fedora: `Liberation Mono`
- Ubuntu Mono is bundled in Ubuntu
- DejaVu Sans Mono is [bundled](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DejaVu_fonts) in all major distros:

    > DejaVu fonts can be obtained from the DejaVu project on GitHub. Some operating systems (OpenBSD, Solaris, Haiku, AmigaOS 4, GNU/Linux distributions such as Ubuntu, Debian, Fedora, and RHEL) include DejaVu fonts in their default installation,[3][4][5][6][7] sometimes even using them as their system fonts.

- Inconsolata looks like this:

  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/65921116-2cef7180-e396-11e9-8b56-91d78ddcefca.png)
  
  Normally

  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4033249/65921112-2b25ae00-e396-11e9-8bdc-bd27c2f4c3d0.png)

title: [BUG] Weird Issues
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Writing code or text in any file (JSON config files, classes files, etc.)
2. Get this annoying error 
`{
	"resource": "/c:/Users/Angel/Documents/Programming/Dart/projects/Test Web/test_routes/test_routes/lib/route_generator.dart",
	"owner": "languageErrors441",
	"severity": 8,
	"message": "Parse error on line 1:\n\n^\nExpecting 'STRING', 'NUMBER', 'NULL', 'TRUE', 'FALSE', '{', '[', got '1'",
	"startLineNumber": 1,
	"startColumn": 1,
	"endLineNumber": 1,
	"endColumn": 1
}`
3. Reload VSCode
4. Error goes away

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10191085/65913582-2b29ac00-e39e-11e9-9efc-c500fdbef8a8.png)

It happens in every Workspace, every language I'm working with (Dart, C#, Python, AS3, Javascript). Also happens with extensions disabled. This looks like the issue I've been reporting lately that Intelli-Sense just stop auto-completing object members or built-in functions/properties/keywords after a while of working on VSCode. This other issue also gets solved by reloading the workspace.


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes

title: File path in Vscode terminal is not clickable to jump into again.
body:
- Version: 1.38.1
- OS Mojave 10.14.6:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open terminal, ran Angular project and on purpose made a mistake in file to get error in terminal. For link it works but not for file path.
Installed the same version on Windows 10 and worked but not on MacOS.
![2019-09-30 21 47 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23317853/65910922-faf90200-e3cb-11e9-9a28-cefac8499c04.gif)




Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: September 2019 Endgame
body:
- *September 30th* Code freeze for the endgame
- *October 4th* [Endgame done](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Development-Process#inside-an-iteration)
- *October 9th* Expected release date (this may change)

> **Note:** The `Insiders` build needs to be in the wild for 24 hours before we can enter the last phase of the endgame.

##### Monday
- [x] Run [OSS tool](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-build-tools/tree/master/distro-tools) **endgame master**
- [x] Code freeze at 5pm PT
- [x] Ensure we have a green build on all platforms at 5pm PT
- [x] All test items contain sufficiently comprehensive test descriptions by 6pm PT
- [x] Update your availability for testing here - https://vscode-tools.azurewebsites.net/

##### Tuesday
- [x] Test plan items assigned (using https://vscode-tools.azurewebsites.net/)
  - Run the tool multiple times to balance load if test items come in later and assignments are already made
- [x] [üîñAll closed feature-requests](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+archived%3Afalse+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22+user%3Amicrosoft+label%3Afeature-request+-label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Aon-testplan+-label%3Averified+sort%3Aupdated-desc+) either have a `verification-needed` or `on-testplan` label
- [x] Test build starts at 7am CET
- [x] Test plan ready by 8am CET
- [x] [üîñTesting](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+archived%3Afalse+label%3Atestplan-item+user%3Amicrosoft)
- [x] [üîñVerification needed](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+archived%3Afalse+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22+user%3Amicrosoft+label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Averified)

##### Wednesday
- [x] [üîñTesting](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+archived%3Afalse+label%3Atestplan-item+user%3Amicrosoft)
- [x] Remind team members to assign issues that they intend to fix to the current milestone
- [x] Fixing (self-assigned, milestone assigned)
- [x] [üîñVerification needed](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+archived%3Afalse+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22+user%3Amicrosoft+label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Averified)

##### Thursday
- [x] Fixing (scrutiny sets in - major bugs only - to be discussed in stand-up meeting, labeled as `candidate`)
- [x] [üîñVerification needed](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aissue+is%3Aclosed+archived%3Afalse+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22+user%3Amicrosoft+label%3Averification-needed+-label%3Averified)
- [x] [üîñVerification](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aclosed+is%3Aissue+user%3Amicrosoft+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+-label%3Aon-testplan+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3A*duplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+-label%3Aerror-telemetry)
- [x] Check new OSS usage is entered into the [OSS registry](https://ossmsft.visualstudio.com/_apps/hub/ms.vss-oss-web.hub-oss) **owner**

<!--
- [ ] [Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+-label%3Aon-testplan+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3A%2Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+-label%3Aerror-telemetry+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22)
- [ ] [Remote Verification](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-remote-release/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Abug+-label%3Averified+-label%3Aon-testplan+is%3Aclosed+-label%3Aduplicate+-label%3A%2Aduplicate+-label%3Ainvalid+-label%3Aas-designed+-label%3Aerror-telemetry+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22)
-->

##### Friday
- [x] Pause scheduled `insider` builds @mjbvz
- Satellite modules/npm packages ready, version updated, smoke tested
  - [x] vscode **@bpasero**
  - [x] yo generator **@aeschli**
  - [x] vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] node debug **@weinand**

- [x] Fixing (only critical bugs - no string changes)
- [Smoketest](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/wiki/Smoke-Test) (‚ö†Ô∏è MUST run with `--stable-build` argument ‚ö†Ô∏è )

- [ ] Acknowledge pull requests in release notes. We acknowledge PRs from outside the team. Use the [thankyou](https://vscode-tools.azurewebsites.net/#acknowledgePRs) tool to generate the initial contents of the section. **owner**
  - [x] vscode **endgame master**

  - [x] vscode-node-debug2 **@roblourens**
  - [x] vscode-debugadapter-node **@weinand**
  - [x] vscode-languageserver-node **@dbaeumer**

  - [x] vscode-textmate **@alexandrudima**

  - [x] vscode-vsce **@joaomoreno**
  - [x] vscode-docs **@gregvanl**
  - [x] vscode-css-languageservice **@aeschli**

- [x] Review pull requests acknowledgements with `NOT MERGED - PLS REVIEW`. @mjbvz
- [x] Acknowledge issue trackers from the community **@alexandrudima**
- [x] Add notable fixes to the release notes **all**
- When done fixing/verifying and there are changes since last build at the end of day PT
  - [ ] Trigger new insider build and publish it manually @mjbvz

##### Friday/Monday
- [x] Branch code to `release/<x.y> @mjbvz
- [x] Bump up the version in package.json - @mjbvz
- [x] Announce master is open for business @mjbvz
- [x] Polish release notes **redmond**

##### Monday - Wednesday
- [ ] [üîñOpen milestone issues](https://github.com/issues?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+user%3Amicrosoft+milestone%3A%22September+2019%22)

> **Note:** The `Insiders` build needs to be in the wild for 24 hours before we can enter the last phase of the endgame. **endgame master**

##### Wednesday/Thursday

- [ ] Add a git tag to `HEAD` of `release/<x.y>` in format `x.y.z` (for vscode.d.ts download)  **endgame master**

- [ ] Enable scheduled `insider` builds **endgame master**
- [ ] Twitter announcement **@chrisdias**

title: Error when Download command is used on a folder
body:
- Connect to a remote
- Right click on a folder in the explorer
- Click "Download"
- See an error notification pop up, "Unable to open '<folder name>': File is a directory"

But I do get the save as dialog and can download the folder.

title: Relaunching insiders with custom CLI Args fails due to missing 1.39.0-insider-main.sock
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
Version: 1.39.0-insider
Commit: 601e3e0762ac93e03cfef8336be8223bf32754e1
Date: 2019-09-30T05:30:22.799Z
Electron: 6.0.9
Chrome: 76.0.3809.146
Node.js: 12.4.0
V8: 7.6.303.31-electron.0
OS: Darwin x64 18.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download VS Code Insiders
2. Launch Insiders with custom cli args as follows:
Each argument is in a separate line for brevity
```'<vs code dir>/Visual Studio Code - Insiders.app' --user-data-dir='<user dir>'```
3. Exit VS Code after a few seconds.
4. Run the same command once again, and here's the error that is logged:
```
[main 2019-09-30T14:32:33.883Z] Could not delete obsolete instance handle Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, unlink '<user dir>/1.39.0-insider-main.sock'
    at Object.unlinkSync (original-fs.js:976:3)
    at Object.doStartup (<vs code dir>/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:534:676)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:89:5) {
  errno: -2,
  syscall: 'unlink',
  code: 'ENOENT',
  path: '<user dir>/1.39.0-insider-main.sock'
}
[main 2019-09-30T14:32:33.886Z] Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, unlink '<user dir>/1.39.0-insider-main.sock'
    at Object.unlinkSync (original-fs.js:976:3)
    at Object.doStartup (<vs code dir>/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:534:676)
    at processTicksAndRejections (internal/process/task_queues.js:89:5)
(base) 

```
<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: N/A

title: Dimmed / desaturated colors / font rendering issue on latest Insiders build (macOs)
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:
```sh
‚ùØ code-insiders -v
1.39.0-insider
9f6a745027fc7b2a12495970f64625e24f410224
x64
```
- OS Version:
Mojave 10.14.6 (18G95)

After updating to latest Insiders build all the colors in the editor and explorer look strikingly dimmed / desaturated. No settings were changed during the udpate, so that seems like a regression to me. Used color theme Monokai

Were there any changes to color display specific to mac?

You can still see vibrant colors in the minimap tho

 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15550153/65877728-0aa92400-e395-11e9-9c47-4774cb802334.png)

Same on a stable release

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/15550153/65882673-26fd8e80-e39e-11e9-9aac-3eb840f811ef.png)



<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes

title: Process explorer not visible after alt-tab to VS Code
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VS Code
2. Open process explorer
3. Alt-tab away from VS Code
4. Alt-tab back to VS Code

Expected result:
Process explorer window is visible

Actual result:
Process explorer window is hidden by VS Code main window.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Only immediate file/folder symlinks show up in Explorer panel

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.37.1
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601

I share a Windows folder i.e. ```D:\shared``` with my VirtualBox's Centos via the ```Shared Folder``` setting.
When I create symlinks inside my project folder from Centos, i.e. ```D:\shared\project```, only some of them show up in the ```Explorer panel``` of Windows VS Code. I refer to these as immediate symlinks, please see below for clearer examples.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Change folder to ```/shared/project```, i.e. ```D:\shared\project```
2. ```ln -s ../repo/ slinkfolder1``` - trying to link to ```D:\shared\repo```, a parent folder
3. ```ln -s storage/app/ slinkfolder2``` - trying to link to ```D:\shared\project\storage\app```, a child folder
4. ```ln -s storage/ slinkfolder3``` - trying to link to ```D:\shared\project\storage```, an immediate folder
5. ```slinkfolder1``` and ```slinkfolder2``` does not show up in the ```Explorer panel```, only ```slinkfolder3``` can be located

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No
Yes

title: Better Touch using

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: Issue Type: Feature Request Hello, I realised it is not easy to select text on a touch screen. This is, because all touch gestures are interpreted as scrolling and not as selecting. I looked what Notepad++ does. This is very interesting. Notepad++ works differently depending on what direction the touch swiping starts. If it starts vertically (up/down) then ist is scrolling and if it starte horizontally (left/right) it is selecting. - It should be noted, that even if you start moving the finger up or down for scrolling, if the scrolling has started you still can scroll left or right. If you are in selection mode (left/right movement) you can also select up and down. So the application looks how the movement started. This is a really cool and accassible way of using touch in this program. Visual Studio code should work in a similar way. (PS: This whole way of using with touch reminds me of the clever way Tiles worked Windows 8. Unfortunately Microsoft forgot about that, when they switched scrolling direction of Tiles in Windows 10.) VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362

title: Run filetype autodetection when text is copied into a new empty tab

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

I think the following scenario can be improved:
1. User copies (Ctrl+C) text of python script from somewhere.
2. User opens a new tab in text editor
3. User pasts (Ctrl+V) the copied text into the new empty tab
4. The copied text is not getting highlighted as "Python" even though it has `#!/usr/bin/env python` as the first line. If I save the same text as "opaque_data" named file and open it in VSCode - it will successfully auto-detect it as Python code. The same detection algorithm can be triggered in case of text copy into a new **empty** buffer, and it should also trigger a special event for VSCode extensions.

title: Missing useful information in notifications
body:
I create a new file, write some things without saving and then select in the menu:
Terminal >> Run Active File

I get the notification:
"Only files on disk can be run in the terminal"
but I ignore it for now. Later, I see there's a notification so I click the :bell: icon and see the above message, but there's no timestamp on it, some text from the file, the tab name or the exact name of the action I was doing to help me identify which file and which action this notification is about.

title: enable strictFunctionTypes in VS Code codebase
Display license link for VSIX packages in Extensions View

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
You can see information such as download count, link to a repository, and a license link in the extensions view for items downloaded from the marketplace.

My company does not want to publish our extension in the marketplace and instead distribute a VSIX file.  I included license information in the package.json and created a VSIX files for testing.   I am able to see details in the extensions view after installing the VSIX package.  But,  a license link does not appear. I assume you must publish the extension to display the link.

If there is a way to display the license link in this scenario, it's not clear to me how to do it.  So the feature request would be to display a license link or document how to show it if that's already possible.

title: Expanding semantic theming to support semantically embedded languages for colorization
body:
## Overview

Languages like Razor (and I imagine HTML for custom attributes) typically have scenarios where portions of the document are semantically a different language.

In Razor this happens frequently through the use of TagHelpers or in Blazor:
```Razor
<form asp-antiforgery="ViewBag.ShouldRenderAntiforgery">
...
</form>
```

In this example we'd expect that `ViewBag.ShouldRenderAntiforgery` would be C#. The way TagHelpers (things that apply to HTML and change the semantic language of the right hand side of an attribute) can be customized by users is limitless so we need to have full control over telling the IDE what things are C# and what things aren't.

## Ideas on how to implement

Over in the [issue ](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/77133) where the discussion of general semantic colorization the proposal was to have an API similar to:

```TypeScript
interface SemanticHighlightRangeProvider {
   provideHighlightRanges(doc,...): [ Range, TokenType, TokenModifier[] ][];
}
```

The proposed approach can also be used to enable semantic language colorization without enabling an entire language's extensions for a subset of a document.

To do this one could expand on the `ThemeDefinition` and add a `language` parameter:
```TypeScript
interface TokenStyle {
   foreground?: Color | ColorFunction
   style?: bold | italic | underline
   language?: string
}
```
This would enable LanguageServers to mark a chunk of text in an editor as a Token that associates with a specific language. This would work similarly to how tooltips/completion descriptions etc. work when specifying pieces of text that should be colorized as a certain language.

So in the first example `asp-antiforgery="ViewBag.ShouldRenderAntiforgery"` Razor's language server would indicate that the entire `ViewBag.ShouldRenderAntiforgery` was of a Razor specific theme that had a token Style of:
```JSON
{
    "language": "csharp"
}

This would enable future scenarios where if Razor wanted to go above and beyond to provide semantic colorization of specific tokens it could do it in an additive fashion on top of existing theme.
